009
010package imagingbook.pub.color.filters;
011
012import java.util.Arrays;
013
014import imagingbook.lib.filters.GenericFilter;
015import imagingbook.lib.image.access.ImageAccessor;
016import imagingbook.lib.image.access.ScalarAccessor;
017
018/**
019 * Ordinary (scalar) median filter for color images implemented
020 * by extending the {@link GenericFilter} class.
021 * Color images are filtered individually in all channels.
022 * @author W. Burger
023 * @version 2013/05/30
024 */
025public class ScalarMedianFilter extends GenericFilter {
026        
027        public static class Parameters {
028                /** Filter radius */
029                public double radius = 3.0;
030        }
031        
032        final Parameters params;
033        FilterMask mask;
034
035        //-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
036        
037        public ScalarMedianFilter() {
038                this(new Parameters());
039        }
040        
041        public ScalarMedianFilter(Parameters params) {
042                this.params = params;
043                this.mask = new FilterMask(params.radius);
044        }
045                
046        //-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
047
048        @Override
049        public float filterScalar(ScalarAccessor source, int u, int v) {
050                final int maskCount = mask.getCount();
051                final float[] p = new float[maskCount];
052                final int medianIndex = maskCount/2;
053                final int maskCenter = mask.getCenter();
054                final int[][] maskArray = mask.getMask();
055                int k = 0;
056                for (int i = 0; i < maskArray.length; i++) {
057                        int ui = u + i - maskCenter;
058                        for (int j = 0; j < maskArray[0].length; j++) {
059                                if (maskArray[i][j] > 0) {
060                                        int vj = v + j - maskCenter;
061                                        p[k] = source.getVal(ui, vj);
062                                        k = k + 1;
063                                }
064                        }
065                }
066                Arrays.sort(p);
067                return p[medianIndex];
068        }
069
070        @Override
071        public float[] filterVector(ImageAccessor source, int u, int v) {
072                final int maskCount = mask.getCount();
073                final float[] pR = new float[maskCount];
074                final float[] pG = new float[maskCount];
075                final float[] pB = new float[maskCount];
076                //final int[] pctr = new int[3];
077                //final float[] pF = new float[3];
078                final int medianIndex = maskCount/2;
079                final int maskCenter = mask.getCenter();
080                final int[][] maskArray = mask.getMask();
081                int k = 0;
082                for (int i=0; i<maskArray.length; i++) {
083                        int ui = u + i - maskCenter;
084                        for (int j=0; j<maskArray[0].length; j++) {
085                                if (maskArray[i][j] > 0) {
086                                        int vj = v + j - maskCenter;
087                                        float[] pctr = source.getPix(ui,vj);
088                                        pR[k] = pctr[0];
089                                        pG[k] = pctr[1];
090                                        pB[k] = pctr[2];
091                                        k = k + 1;
092                                }
093                        }
094                }
095                Arrays.sort(pR); //pF[0] = pR[medianIndex];
096                Arrays.sort(pG); //pF[1] = pG[medianIndex];
097                Arrays.sort(pB); //pF[2] = pB[medianIndex];
098                return new float[] { pR[medianIndex], pG[medianIndex], pB[medianIndex] };
099        }
100}
